intro: Gonostemon rufus var. attenuatus, commonly known as the slender redstem, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive red stems. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
